definition: to be able to withstand/to be able to endure
classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
surname Jing
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: Accepted and run, let love stand the fleeting time.
sentences.chinese: 接纳与磨合，让爱经得起流年。

sentences.english: Haba toys are a great choice that will stand the test of time.
sentences.chinese: 哈巴玩具是一个不错的选择，经得起时间的考验。

sentences.english: A name is like a boat which stands the strong wind and striking wave in the sea.
sentences.chinese: 名字的含义是像小船一样在大海里经得起风吹浪打。

sentences.english: Will your tax statement stand up to detailed examination?
sentences.chinese: 你的有关税收的报告经得起详细审查吗？

sentences.english: I believe it will stand the test of time.
sentences.chinese: 我相信这份报告会经得起时间考验。

sentences.english: But would such a sleight of hand really stand up to legal scrutiny in the aftermath of Armageddon?
sentences.chinese: 但这种戏法真的经得起末日审判的法律审查吗？

sentences.english: Practice has proven that the bilateral relations have withstood the tests of time.
sentences.chinese: 实践证明中塞黑关系是经得起时间考验的。

sentences.english: A accumulated backbone of a archful of animal hair is able of acknowledging a counterbalancet agnate to that of 99 humans.
sentences.chinese: 满头头发合在一起的力气可经得起99个人的分量。

sentences.english: Turth is the daughter of time.
sentences.chinese: 真理经得起时间的考验。

sentences.english: Her claim can bear close examination.
sentences.chinese: 她的要求经得起仔细检查。

sentences.english: The packing must be able to withstand rough handling.
sentences.chinese: 包装必须经得起野蛮搬运。

sentences.english: Its four-dimensional beauty can stand up0 time.
sentences.chinese: 建筑的美是四维的，他能经得起时间的磨移。

sentences.english: Children’s furniture must withstand kicks and blows.
sentences.chinese: 孩子用的家具必须经得起拳打脚踢。

sentences.english: Metal can bear beating with a hammer, which a stone can't.
sentences.chinese: 金属能经得起锤子的敲打，但石头却不行。

sentences.english: Cars and girls go perfectly well together, it is tested by time.
sentences.chinese: 香车美女的绝配，是经得起时间的考验的。
世卫组织经得起这一审查。

definition: can't stand it/to be unable to bear/to be unable to resist
to undergo (hardship)/to endure/to withstand
after hard work and numerous revisions (idiom)/the vicissitudes of life
to test/to put to the test/trial/ordeal
to become more resolute with the passing of time (idiom)
to experience/to go through
to go through thick and thin (idiom)
to inspect/to examine/to test
baptism (lit. or fig.)
to sharpen on grindstone/to improve oneself by practice
True gold fears no fire. (idiom)
pinyin: zhen1 jin1 bu4 pa4 huo3 lian4

definition: unswerving from start to finish (idiom)
capable of enduring/able to tolerate/patient/durable/hardy/resistant
not to let sb down/to treat sb fairly/be worthy of
to ravage/to ruin
touchstone/fig. test that sth is genuine
